content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>The Nature Conservancy</origin> <pubdate>January 2005</pubdate> <title>South America General Geology</title> <geoform>remote-sensing image</geoform> <onlink><http://rmgsc.cr.usgs.gov/ecosystems/></onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>South America General Geology dataset was produced by mosaicing the Eastern South America Division (ESA) General Geology dataset and the Southern South America (SSA) General Geology dataset. These two general geology datasets were modeled from detailed South America geology data (Geologic Data Systems Inc. (GDS) compiled geological information from over 50 published maps to create a digital geology map of South America.)</abstract> <purpose>Used as a primary input data layer in the development of unique ecosystem gridcodes for the South America ecological systems mapping project.</purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>Various</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Based on publication year of each country geology map digitized by Geologic Data Systems (GDS) to produce the South America geology data.</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Unknown</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-117.795439</westbc> <eastbc>3.096229</eastbc> <northbc>14.836017</northbc> <southbc>-55.980651</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>Geology</themekt> <themekey>Geology</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekey>South America</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>Unknown</accconst> <useconst>Unknown</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Jerry Touval</cntper> <cntorg>The Nature Conservancy</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntemail>jtouval@tnc.org</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc> A.R. Kruckeberg's (2002) book on "Geology and Plant Life" was used as the main source for developing a simplified geology classification that best reflected the underlying general geologic classes of the target LAC ecological systems across the study area. Each unique geology class in the GDS dataset was reviewed and assigned to one of the nine general geology classes listed below (the last two classes, salt and glacial, were added during the SSA phase of the project). 1355 unique geology classes were identified in the ESA, and 1067 in the SSA. These numbers are high because the geology data was compiled from each country's detailed geological map(s). Many of these classes represent the same type of geology but are identified as unique classes because each country used a different classification system. A new general geology "reclass" field was added to the geology shapefiles (filenames: esa_geology_s.shp and ssa_geology_s.shp). Several fields in the geology table were reviewed to determine which general class to assign each of the unique geological records (NAME and DESCRIPT fields, and when available, the ROCK_CLASS, ROCK_SUBCL and LITH_CHM_GR fields). In addition, original geology classes that clearly followed river networks, which were identified as sedimentary not alluvial in the related tabular data, were attributed to the alluvium class based on a visual examination of their geographic extent. A number of unique geology classes had insufficient information to correctly identify them and were classified as unknown. Some of these unknown areas in Brazil and Uruguay were later classified by Marcelo Matusmoto (TNC, Brasilia, Brazil). A numeric coding field (numcode_f) was added to the geology shapefile based on the Reclass text field and used to convert the geology shapefiles to 450 meter grids (filenames: esa_gengeol_s and ssa_gengeol_s). These generalized geology grids were projected to Sinusoidal and smoothed (3 iterations) using a focalmajority filter with a square NAW of 3 cells to remove single cell occurrences, and then mosaiced into a final South America general geology grid (filename: sa_gengeol_s). </procdesc> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc>Metadata imported.</procdesc> <srcused>C:\\TEMP\\xml73.tmp</srcused>
